page.title: 16PUBLIC HOUSES
page.content: There used to be 96 Public Houses in Cowes ,but over the years the number has come down to ten in the High Street.Pubs make the most money in the summer but they need extra staff so they offer jobs to school leavers and students.Most of the customers are local sailors, yachts men,tourists and business men. Of particular interest in the High Street are:{THE ANCHOR}-A coaching inn c.1700 with the stable block now used as a bistro.{THE TAVERN}-flooded in extreme high tides (high stools provided for patrons){THE UNION INN} -popular with seamen,originally a fisherman's cottage.The{COPPER KETTLE} - once taproom of the Marine Hotel and visited by Press Gangs- has a ghost. Opening hours are usually extended during{Cowes Week}.
